ReportSection.name: 2 - Project Summary
ReportSection.title: Section 2 - Project Summary
ReportSection.ReportItem:
2.1: Lay Project Summary

  • Provide a non-confidential project summary in lay terms.
  • A lay summary is an overview of a project described in a way that can be easily understood by those without prior experience of the subject.
  • This summary may be used externally in media releases, communications and will be posted on CFN’s website.
{$item}

2.2: Scientific Project Summary

  • Provide a non-confidential scientific project summary, highlighting the objectives, milestones and deliverables, outputs and outcomes (impacts).
  • This summary may be used externally in media releases, communications and CFN’s website.
{$item}

ReportSection.name: 3 - Project Description
ReportSection.title: Section 3 - Project Description
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Upload a single PDF document named Ancillary2022-##-Surname_ProjectDescription.pdf. The Surname refers to the Project Leader’s surname. The Project description cannot exceed 5 pages and must be single spaced in Calibri 12 font with 1-inch margins.

The Project Description must address the following:

3.1 Background, Knowledge Gap(s) and Rationale

  • Provide a comprehensive review of the background literature and identify the knowledge gaps relevant to the proposal as it relates to AVOID Frailty and the KFLA Regional Centre for Healthy Aging.
  • Clearly state the rationale for the project and how the results of the study may be used to improve how older adults can age well in their community.

3.2 Hypothesis and/or Study Question(s)

  • State the proposed hypothesis and/or research question(s) to be addressed in the study.

3.3 Overall Goal and Objectives

  • Describe the overall goal and specific objectives of the study.

3.4 Study Milestones, Deliverables, Outputs and Outcomes

  • Describe all milestones, outputs and outcomes for the study.
  • Provide a study schedule for all milestones, outputs, and outcomes for the duration of the study, including future plans if study is successful. The project schedule is mandatory and will be used to track progress of the study.

3.5 Methodological Approach

  • Describe the overall study design (approaches, procedures and methods) that will be used in the study and why they are appropriate to meet the goals and objectives and deliver upon the proposed outputs and outcomes.
  • Describe how this project will be managed and evaluated for success.
  • Note: The KFLA Centre for Healthy Aging has developed an intake questionnaire that collects participant information to assesses health and well-being, including frailty. Studies will either recruit their own participants, utilize participants already enrolled with the KFLA Centre for Healthy Aging and or a combination of the two. For additional information on specific aspects of the KFLA Centre for Healthy Aging click here.

3.6 Barriers and Challenges

  • Identify all feasibility issues, barriers, challenges and limitations to the successful execution and completion of the study. Specifically address issues related to budget constraints, time constraints, structural issues, and organizational and personnel challenges that may delay timely completion of the study.
  • Describe plans on mitigating and overcoming these barriers, challenges and limitations.

3.7 Description of Study Team

  • Describe the expertise and experience of each team member to demonstrate that the team can achieve the goals and objectives of the study.
  • Note: All Individual team members will need to be listed in the Project Team Information Excel document (see Application Instructions).

3.8 Highly Qualified Personnel (HQP)

  • Describe the role of each HQP trainee who will be directly involved in a meaningful way in the study HQP can be part-time or full-time graduate/doctoral/post-doctoral or undergraduate students, residents, fellows or working professionals.

3.9 Citizen Engagement

  • Describe how knowledge users (e.g., older adults and their family or friend caregivers with lived experience, decision makers, stakeholders) are involved in the study in a meaningful and tightly integrated manner.
  • For clarity, meaningfully involved participation of knowledge users includes being involved in the planning and execution of the project and/or in assisting in the interpretation and translation/mobilization of the findings.
{$item}
